description: Custom-trained DeepSeek model for code generation, focused on user's AI agent project written in Python, Groovy, and other languages.
status: STEP 1 completed — Git initialized and directory structure created.
model_nature: private, but may use public cloud models if they improve performance

execution_environment.local_machine: used for code editing and triggering training
execution_environment.gpu_machine: used for training, running Ubuntu 24.04 with full CUDA & Python stack
execution_environment.shared_storage: /mnt/deepseek mounted via NFS on both machines

codebase.documentation_status: Complete module-level docs and dependency definitions available

data_handling.input_sources: source code from real agent project
data_handling.format: to be converted to jsonl prompt-response format
data_handling.scope: model must see full context, not isolated snippets

instructions_policy.language: All comments, configs, instructions in English
instructions_policy.code_generation: No code is generated unless explicitly requested
instructions_policy.prompt_mode: The model is expected to generate code only, not chat-style answers

progress: ✅ Git repository initialized and pushed to remote
✅ Agent role clarified: tool for code generation, not dialogue
next_steps: STEP 2 — download base model into models/base/
STEP 3 — prepare dataset from actual agent code (cross-repository)
STEP 4 — convert dataset into jsonl training format
STEP 5 — run LoRA training with train_lora.py
STEP 6 — evaluate trained model against example prompts
STEP 7 — optionally tag and freeze trained version
